info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 1:09PM CDT until July 16 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... Southern Sevier County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern McCurtain County in southeastern Oklahoma... Marion County in northeastern Texas... Cass County in northeastern Texas... Harrison County in northeastern Texas... Bowie County in northeastern Texas... East central Upshur County in northeastern Texas... Southeastern Morris County in northeastern Texas... Central Gregg County in northeastern Texas... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 108 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Arkinda to 9 miles southwest of Maud to Longview, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Longview, Texarkana, Marshall, Kilgore, White Oak, Atlanta, Wake Village, Ashdown, New Boston, Horatio, Foreman, Hallsville, Nash, Hooks, Waskom, Jefferson, Linden, Hughes Springs, Queen City and Ore City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
